meta.description: Delta Air Lines Delta Sky Club (Gate A17) at Hartsfield–Jackson Atlanta International Airport (ATL), Concourse A. Learn more about the lounge: amenities, photos, review, opening hours, location.

lounge.name: Delta Air Lines Delta Sky Club (Gate A17)
lounge.description: The Delta Sky Club is an award-winning retreat that allows relaxation, productivity, or both.

reviews.content: It’s okay, but often quite busy. Current food offerings are poor and consist of packaged small sliders and salads. Bar offerings are decent though. There are better DL clubs in ATL.
Enjoyed this lounge better than the one in concourse E. Layout made a busy airport lounge seem less crowded. Food choices are not as vast as some specialty lounges but overall a decent stopover.
This is the worst of the Delta lounges at ATL. Needs repair and updating. Only 2 of the stalls in the bathroom have working locks and one of them doesn't have a hook for your bag.
So-so lounge. Crowded, too warm to get comfortable and no bottled water.
Decent lounge and some nice vegetarian food options. Super friendly staff. Great WiFi.
Went at 10:35p today (Tuesday) and it was already closed but LoungeBuddy says open till 11:00pm. Not sure if app is wrong or lounge closed early.
Arguably the worst Delta lounge at ATL, maybe even the US.
Nice lounge. Plenty of open seating on a Saturday afternoon with really attentive bartenders.
At 8pm on a weekday, not crowded. Very nice, F&B definitely a notch above domestic UA and AA lounges, though not at the international lounge level.
It’s a comfortable enough and clean enough lounge. But the food offerings leave a lot to be desired. Nice view of the airport.
Very poor customer service, the woman at the front desk (Jill) was very rude upon my arrival. Food could be improved as well. I’ve been to far better Delta Sky lounges.
Food was delicious and plentiful. Bartender was amazing and super friendly. All staff were very hospitable and accommodating.
They also charged me $29 for a guest. Was at a Sky Club a few weeks ago and there was no guest charge. Calling AMEX when I land.  The food also wasn’t great and not very customer service oriented.
Lounge closes at 10pm. She wouldn't let me in after 930.
They do not give free access to a guest when with an AmEx Platinum card. First time that ever happened in a Sky Club. Food choice extremely limited. It is large & comfortable.
Riley the bartender at A17 apparently can’t handle her job without being rude to guests. An older gentleman asked her a questions and she snapped back with a sarcastic answer and nasty look.
La gente no es un problema que se les ocurra qué.
Great club. Great staff. Big and clean. Better than others.
Great space, bathrooms and options of foods and beverage. Did the trick for me.
Lots of space! Good food and clean restrooms. The seat cushions were uncomfortable and flat. You will need to take the escalator up to the entrance and then the stairs or elevator to the lounge.
Comfortable, soup and salad bar fresh and tasty.
Editing my review to say that the restrooms here are now nice! The business area, bar, self-serve area, and staff were all great aspects to this lounge too.
Spacious and not crowded, clean lounge and restrooms are well tended. Strict Delta policy about not bringing in food, even if needed for allergies.

Wasn't very impressed by this one. Odd layout for me, but the bathrooms were nice. Didn't appreciate no notice that if you took the stairs up instead of the elevator you would be climbing quite a bit.
Refurbished a few years ago. A good light SC with nice views, but I still prefer the other A terminal SC as this one always seems crowded. Standard decent SC food/drink options.
Solid, free drinks, decent seating, decent snacks.
Visited early in the morning. Very nice lounge for domestic travel. The food could be better though. Basic continental fare.
Large open space. Horrible snacks. They think their passengers are rabbits. It's all salad and carrots crudités. Boring! Kick up the snacks a notch and it'd be 5 star.
Lounge is much bigger than the one by Gate A11.

Large, open, noisy space. Could use some half walls to separate the areas and maybe help with noise. Restrooms leave little to be desired, not enough stalls and I've seen cleaner gas station bathrooms.
Excellent staff!  Clean and very open feeling.
Very strong drinks. Would have loved a better food selection but overall not bad.
Spacious, diverse seating, healthy food, good view. Favorite of the 4 concourses.
Somewhat older furniture, full bar, very minimal finger foods, a cool Coke machine with all sorts of flavors of soda, lots of space. Wifi is reliable.
Upper level next to PF Chang's. Great view of the terminals and runways. Good breakfast selection. Favorite SkyClub in ATL!
Surprisingly large, plenty of seating options. Was not packed at all at 8:45 AM Monday. In that regard, it is much better than the other A concourse lounge.
Nice, very large lounge.  Many seating options with outlets everywhere.  Wasn't packed when I was there but I could imagine it being hectic when packed.
Simple lounge. Definitely on par with what one would expect.
The large size is a plus, but sometimes, they run out of food during breakfast.
This is a large lounge that has two styles: old-style, and modern. There are many seating options in this place.

otherLounges.name: Delta Air Lines Delta Sky Club

Proceed up to the Mezzanine Level, follow signs to the lounge entrance.
